intro: Basonca, commonly known as the white basonca, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its delicate, white to pale pink flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub, reaching heights of up to 1 meter. Its leaves are opposite, elliptical, and have a smooth texture. Basonca is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and landscapes.
